oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 19th century bottle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Embossed design "pumpkin-seed" bottle, presumably for wine, with words "Genl. Taylor never surrenders" a cannon, and "Little more grape Capt. Bragg" referring to a famous Mexican War incident at Battle of Buena Vista in February 1847. Bragg, at the time a captain of artillery, is ordered by General Taylor to increase his fire against the attacking Mexican Army. The story may be apcrophyal, but it made Bragg a national hero in the aftermath of the Mexican War. Bragg would join the Confederate Army in 1861.
